fields.Transcription: Hola, bon dia! Em dic Guillem i s√≥c... vinc de Catalunya, de Girona, de fet, al nord de Catalunya, per√≤ ara estic estudiant un m√†ter aqu√≠ a Holanda, a la universitat de Groningen. √âs un m√†ster sobre multiling√ºisme, perqu√®... bueno, a mi m'agraden molt les lleng√ºes i vaig decidir venir aqu√≠ a fer el m√†ster. Per√≤ el m√†ster aquest √©s de la universitat de Groningen, per√≤ les classes es fan a Leeuwarden, la capital de la prov√≠ncia de Fr√≠sia. I jo ara visc a Leeuwarden, Ljouwert en fris√≥. Estic aprenent fris√≥ i holand√®s, i estic fent les meves pr√†ctiques a Af√ªk, que √©s l'organitzaci√≥ de la promoci√≥ de la llengua frisona. A mi m'agraden molt les lleng√ºes, sobretot les lleng√ºes minoritzades, i va ser un dels motius pels quals vaig decidir venir aqu√≠ a Holanda, concretament a Leeuwarden. Per√≤ no va ser l'√∫nic, perqu√® el motiu principal per venir a Leeuwarden aquest any √©s que Leeuwarden √©s una de les dues capitals de la Cultura Europea aquest any, juntament amb La Valetta, a Malta. I especialment a Leeuwarden, i a Frysl√¢n, a tota la prov√≠ncia, fan moltes coses amb lleng√ºes durant aquest any. Tenen el L√¢n fan taal, tenen el Talepaviljoen, que √©s el Pavell√≥ de Lleng√ºes, on... b√©, durant... des de finals de mar√ß fins a finals d'octubre fan diferents coses amb diferent lleng√ºes d'arreu del m√≥n, sobretot d'Europa. Les primeres deu setmanes s√≥n lleng√ºes d'Holanda: diferents varietats del baix alemany, el fris√≥, el limburgu√®s... Despr√©s v√©nen, durant deu setmanes, lleng√ºes minoritzades europees, entre les quals hi ha l'asturi√†, el gallec, el basc... per√≤ tamb√© el s√≤rab, per exemple, o el malt√®s, o l'irland√®s... I les √∫ltimes deu setmanes, hi ha lleng√ºes parlades a Leeuwarden, que inclou el Liwwarders, que √©s la llengua d'aqu√≠ a Leeuwarden, que √©s una esp√®cie de barreja entre l'holand√®s i el fris√≥, per√≤ tamb√© lleng√ºes de la immigraci√≥, com pot ser el rus, o el vietnam√®s, o el papiamento, o el que sigui. I res, el programa √©s molt interessant i us volem convidar a venir i a passar-vos-ho b√© aqu√≠ amb nosaltres al Pavell√≥ de Lleng√ºes.
fields.Translation:
"This video was recorded at the Af√ªk, in Leeuwarden, the Neterlands by Guillem Belmar, where he was doing an internship for the Language Pavilion, as part of the partnership between Af√ªk and Wikitongues. 
Catalan is spoken by as many as 10 million people in Catalonia; the Balearic Islands, Valencia, parts of Aragon and Murcia (in Spain); Andorra; Roussillon (France) and the city of Alghero (Italy). It is recognized as a (co-)official language in Catalonia (alongside Aranese, Spanish and Catalan Sign Language); Andorra; Valencia and the Balearic Islands (alongside Spanish). It is also recognized as a minority language in Italy, but has no recognition in France, nor is it officially recognized in Aragon and Murcia."
fields.Video Description: This video was recorded at the Af√ªk, in Leeuwarden, the Netherlands by Guillem Belmar and features Guillem speaking the Catalan language. Catalan was spoken by 3,750,000 people in Spain as of 2012, with an estimated international population totaling 4,079,420 L1 users. It is recognized as an official language of Catalonia alongside Aranese, Spanish, and Catalan Sign Language, and as an official language of Andorra, Valencia, and the Balearic Islands alongside Spanish. It is also recognized as a minority language in Italy, but has no official recognition in France. Although Catalan, a Romance language derived from Latin, is named for the medieval Principality of Catalonia, it has varieties spoken in places like Valencia and the Balearic Islands where it is known as Valencian. Catalan has born witness to linguistic erosion as it became increasingly displaced by Spanish from the late 1400s to present day, and by French especially after the French Revolution of 1789. Despite these and ongoing challenges to vitality, Catalan remains resilient with efforts by the General Council of the Pyr√©n√©es-Orientales, and by revivalists such as Aribau, Verdaguer, Oller, and Guimer√†. The teaching of Catalan in schools and its official (minority) recognition in Spain have gone a long way to bolster its prestige, though cultural challenges remain.
italki call to action: Get a free Catalan lesson with italki: http://promos.italki.com/wikitongues_cat
Demographics: 3,750,000 in Spain (ELDIA 2012). Population total all countries: 4,079,420. L2 users: 5,150,000 in Spain (ELDIA 2012).
YouTube License Statement: This video is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International license. To download a copy, please contact hello@wikitongues.org.
fields.Geneaology: "[ Indo-European, Italic, Romance, Italo-Western, Western, Gallo-Iberian, Ibero-Romance, East Iberian ]"
